titleStmt.title: The Scotch-mist cleared up, to prevent Englishmen from being wet to the skin being a true account of the proceedings against Archibald Earl of Argyle, for high-treason : wherein are contained eight reasons of several conformable ministers in Scotland against the Test ... : with animadversions on the whole affair.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.

(from t.p.) 1. The Confession of Faith -- 2. The Test -- 3. The Earl of Argyles explanation -- 4. The explanation of the secret council -- 5. The charge against the said Earl -- 6. His trial -- 7. The Act concerning the Test.
An attack on the Test act of 1681.
